Section 11 Data 11.1 Unique Identifiers and Geometry 11.2 Netdown Table 11.3 Transitions/Volumes/Landbase 11.4 Analysis Ready Dataset 11.5 Non-standard Spatial Layers 11.6 Yield

Section 11 Data The resultant datasets from the Mackenzie TSR were assembled using PostgreSQL and archived as as series of pg_dump files located on the MOF FTP server. The following details each of the postgres tables that form the resutant dataset 11.1 Unique Identifiers and Geometry The tsa16_skey.sql.7z file contains the tsa16_skey which has been extracted from the bc_gr_skey. The bc_gr_skey is a one hectare int32 GEOTIFF raster of the entire province buffered by 100 km. The dimensions of the tsa16_skey are based on the extents (bounding box) of the TSA boundary with postive skey values within the boundary and negative skey values external to the boundary. The tsa16_skey containts the ogc_fid which provides a unique identifier for every hectare within the extents of the TSA. The ogc_fid is the primary/foriegn key for all tables in the resultant suite. Table 11.1: tsa16_skey field type description skey integer provincial unique identifier ogc_fid integer gdal unique identifier: foreign key wkb_geometry geometry grided geometry at 1 ha resoltion 11.2 Netdown Table The tsa16_netdown2022.7z contains the tsa16_netdown table which provides a classification label, proportion AFLB and proportion THLB for every hectare in the TSA. It identifies all spatial layers used in the construction of the timber harvesting landbase (for the full netdown script see Chapter 6.) Table 11.2: tsa16_netdown2022 field type description ogc_fid integer gdal unique identifier: foreign key own_lbl character varying ownership label description character varying ownership description forest_fil character varying(10) N2T mus_labl character varying(50) Muskwa-Kechika new_lbl character varying updated ownership label feature_id integer feature_id from VRI (ar2018_inc table) bclcs_lv_4 character varying(10) bc land classification level 4 bclcs_lv_5 character varying(10) bc land classification level 5 wetland_type character varying(1) wetlands from FWA site_index real VRI Site Index spec_cd_1 character varying(10) VRI Leading Species np_desc character varying(5) non=productive description cutblocks2019_fid integer 2019 consolidated cutblocks harvest year for operability patch_id integer operable patch id size integer operable patch size nndist real operable patch nearest neighbor distance isolated integer isolated area flag max_vol2020 double flag n12_inaccessible text Accessibility exclusion flag p13_retention numeric Retention exclusion flag 11.3 Transitions/Volumes/Landbase The tsa16_cur_trans230206.7z file contains the resultant landbase proportion (AFLB/THLB) along with the unique analysis unit identifier and corresponding transition unit number, various model parameters along with current total volume, green and dead volumes per hectare for each hectare in the TSA. The yield table (tsa16_yield_curves221205.7z) joins the transition table on the corresponding au fields. Table 11.3: tsa16_transitions (auinfo table) field type description ogc_fid integer gdal unique identifier: foreign key cur_au2021sp integer current analysis unit id au numeric current analysis unit id auid numeric current analysis unit id regen_delay numeric regeneration delay value mha numeric minimum harvest volume threshold mhv numeric minimum harvest age threshold cmaiage numeric culmination age threshold (not used) oaf1 numeric operational adjustment factor to yield oaf2 numeric incremental operational adjustment factor to yield (value at yr100) standtype text stand type label (old, thrifty, managed) for reporting leadspp1 text Leading species label pplantedau1 numeric Proportion planted plantedau1 numeric transition analysis unit 1 (planted) plantedau2 numeric transtion analysis unit 2 (natural) unmanagedau numeric NYST analysis unit for transition post natural disturbance pctpriority numeric priority proportion for reporting (managed pine proportion) feature_id integer feature id from VRI aflb_net numeric 2022 AFLB inclusion factor cur_vph integer current volume per ha (unadjusted for Sx/Ba mortality) *100 cur_tvph integer current volume per ha (adjusted for Sx/Ba mortality) *100 dead_vol numeric total dead volume (Pl/Sx/Ba)*100 thlb_net numeric 2022 THLB inclusion factor 11.4 Analysis Ready Dataset The tsa16_ar_table.sql.7z contains the 2021 vri and standard layers that make-up the FAIB analysis ready dataset produced annually for every TSA in the Province.The Analysis Ready datasets are pre-compiled base data used as the analytical starting point for all Timber Supply Reviews. double precision Fisher Occupancy Model arch_fid integer Arch Sites arch_grid integer Arch Sites 11.6 Yield The tsa16_yield_curves221205.7z contains the yield curves used for the Mackenzie TSR. Three yield curve was produced for every hectare in the TSA: Current, Future, Disturbance Transition. The Current curve set contains NSYT and MSYT curves for natural and existing managed stands. The Future curve set contains transition curves post model harvest while the Disturbance set contains transition curves when stands are naturally disturbed in the model (for further discussion see Chapter 8.
